items.summary: The status data update frequency has been increased from every 5 minutes to every 2 minutes, enhancing real-time service monitoring. This change tightens the cron schedule in the workflow configuration, significantly reducing data staleness from approximately 5 minutes to 3 minutes at worst. The frontend continues to poll every 60 seconds, ensuring timely updates.

items.title: Streamline Database Queries for Status Page in Status Page ðŸš€
items.summary: This update replaces API calls with a direct PostgreSQL query using a new Python script, significantly improving data retrieval efficiency. The change eliminates timeout issues that previously affected the PlatformBackend, ensuring more reliable status updates. Additionally, the workflow has been adjusted to run every five minutes instead of every minute.

items.title: Enhance Pages Deployment Trigger in Roadmap ðŸš€
items.summary: This update fixes the issue where the Revenue Snapshot and Creator Fees on the Roadmap website stopped updating due to a failure in triggering the Pages deployment workflow. By adding a workflow_run trigger to deploy_pages.yml, the deployment will now occur whenever the sync workflow completes successfully, ensuring timely updates. Additionally, a condition has been implemented to skip deployment if the sync workflow fails.

items.summary: This update renames the CI workflow file from check.yaml to ci.yaml to ensure consistency across all repositories. This change simplifies the CI process and enhances clarity for developers working on the project.
